Content: Hey, I'm thinking of upgrading my phone. I'm torn between the iPhone 15 Pro, Samsung Galaxy S24, or the Pixel 8. What do you think?
What will you primarily use the new phone for? Gaming, photography, battery endurance, or something else?
Mostly for taking photos, I prefer the convenient form factor. It has to have a lot of battery capacity too. I attached the comparison chart for specs.
It looks like Pixel 8 has the largest battery at 4575 mAh. Screen sizes are all around 6.2″ except the iPhone at 6.1″. Which metric matters the most for you?
The Pixel 8 photos honestly look pretty good, although the iPhone 15 Pro seems to have better dynamic range at night. The Galaxy S24 seems to overexpose in low light.
Do you plan to take a lot of videos on your phone?
Yes, I do. I love capturing moments on video, especially when traveling.

Based on my experience, iPhones stabilize videos really well. I'm not sure about Pixel 8 and Galaxy S24. The pro models are expensive, though, especially if you upgrade to the higher storage options, which you might need if you take a lot of videos. You might as well get a dedicated camera.
Yeah, price is a big factor for me. I don't want to spend too much, but I also want a phone that will last me a while.
